text: The 2019 Canoe Slalom World Cup was a series of five races in several canoeing and kayaking categories organized by the International Canoe Federation (ICF). It was the 32nd edition. == Calendar == The series opened with World Cup Race 1 in Lee Valley, England (13–16 June) and ended with the World Cup Final in Prague, Czech Republic (6–8 September). {| class="wikitable" |- ! Label ! Venue ! Date |- align=left |World Cup Race 1 |align=left| Lee Valley |align=left| 14–16 June |- align=left |World Cup Race 2 |align=left| Bratislava |align=left| 21–23 June |- align=left |World Cup Race 3 |align=left| Tacen |align=left| 28–30 June |- align=left |World Cup Race 4 |align=left| Markkleeberg |align=left| 30 August – 1 September |- align=left |World Cup Final |align=left| Prague |align=left| 6–8 September |} == Standings == The winner of each race was awarded 60 points (double points were awarded for the World Cup Final). Points for lower places differed from one category to another. Every participant was guaranteed at least 2 points for participation and 5 points for qualifying for the semifinal run. {| border="0" cellspacing="10" |- | === C1 men === {| cellspacing="1"
